oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Using Indices of Cow Comfort to Predict Stall Use and Lameness
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cook, N. B.
Bennett, T. B.
Nordlund, K. V.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cow comfort
high-group pens
free stalls
bedding material
cow behavior
lameness prevalence
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The objective of this study was to measure several indices of cow comfort for one 24- hour period in the high-group pens of a selection of Wisconsin dairy herds using either sand or rubber-crumb-mattress surface free stalls, and to determine the most appropriate time of day for measurement in terms of their ability to predict cow behavior and lameness prevalence.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2004; 192
